version.description: Schema version that this card requires. If a client is lower than this version the fallbackText will be rendered.

fallbackText.description: Text shown when the client doesn't support the version specified. This can be in markdown format.

backgroundImage.description: An image to use as the background of the card

speak.description: Specifies what should be spoken for this entire Item. This is simple text or SSML fragment

lang.description: The 2-letter ISO-639-1 language used in the card. Used to localize any date/time functions

Action.OpenUrl.description: When Action.OpenUrl is invoked it will show the given url, either by launching it to an external web browser or showing in-situ with embedded web browser.

title.description: Label for button or link that represents this action

iconUrl.description: Optional icon to be shown on the action in conjunction with the title

Action.ShowCard.description: Action.ShowCard defines an inline AdaptiveCard which is shown to the user when it is clicked.

title.description: Label for button or link that represents this action

iconUrl.description: Optional icon to be shown on the action in conjunction with the title

Action.Submit.description: Submit action gathers up input fields, merges with optional data field and generates event to client asking for data to be submitted. It is up to the client to determine how that data is processed. For example: With BotFramework bots the client would send an activity through the messaging medium to the bot.

title.description: Label for button or link that represents this action

iconUrl.description: Optional icon to be shown on the action in conjunction with the title

data.description: initial data that input fields will be combined with. This is essentially 'hidden' properties

AdaptiveCard.description: Card schema for an adaptive card

actions.description: The Actions to show in the card's action bar

body.description: The Card Elements to show in the primary card region

selectAction.description: An Action that will be invoked when the card is tapped or selected. Action.ShowCard not supported

id.description: A unique Id associated with the element

separator.description: The Separator object type describes the look and feel of a separation line between two elements.

Input.Choice.description: Describes a Choice input. The value should be a simple string without a ","

value.description: The raw value for the choice. NOTE: do not use a "," in the value, since MultiSelect ChoiceSet returns a comma-delimited string of choice values

Column.description: Defines a container that is part of a ColumnSet

items.description: The Card Elements to include in the Column

selectAction.description: An Action that will be invoked when the Column is tapped or selected. Action.ShowCard not supported

width.description: "auto", "stretch", or a number representing relative width of the column in the column group

ColumnSet.description: ColumnSet divides a region into Column's allowing elements to sit side-by-side

columns.description: The array of Columns to divide the region into

selectAction.description: An Action that will be invoked when the ColumnSet is tapped or selected. Action.ShowCard not supported

items.description: The Card Elements to render inside the Container

selectAction.description: An Action that will be invoked when the Container is tapped or selected. Action.ShowCard not supported

verticalContentAlignment.description: Defines how the content should be aligned vertically within the container

Fact.description: Describes a Fact in a FactSet as a key/value pair

FactSet.description: The FactSet Item makes it simple to display a series of facts (e.g. name/value pairs) in a tabular form.

HorizontalAlignment.description: Controls how Items are horizontally positioned within their container.

Image.description: The Image Item allows for the inclusion of images in an Adaptive Card.

altText.description: Alternate text for the image for accessibility

selectAction.description: An Action that will be invoked when the Image is tapped or selected. Action.ShowCard not supported

ImageSet.description: The ImageSet allows for the inclusion of a collection images like a photogallery.

images.description: The array of Image elements to show

ImageSize.description: Controls the approximate size of the image. The physical dimensions will vary per host. Specify "auto" for true image dimension or "stretch" to force it to fill the container

ImageStyle.description: Controls the way Images are displayed

Input.ChoiceSet.description: Shows an array of Choice objects

id.description: Id for the value (will be used to identify collected input when Action.Submit is invoked)

isMultiSelect.description: Allow multiple choices to be selected

value.description: The initial choice (or set of choices) that should be selected. For multi-select, specifcy a comma-separated string of values

Input.Date.description: Input.Date collects Date from the user,

id.description: Id for the value (will be used to identify collected input when Action.Submit is clicked)

max.description: hint of maximum value expressed in ISO-8601 format (may be ignored by some clients)

min.description: hint of minimum value expressed in ISO-8601 format (may be ignored by some clients)

placeholder.description: Title Description of the input desired

value.description: The initial value for a field expressed in ISO-8601 format

Input.Number.description: Input.Number collects number from the user,

id.description: Id for the value (will be used to identify collected input when Action.Submit is clicked)

max.description: hint of maximum value (may be ignored by some clients)

min.description: hint of minimum value (may be ignored by some clients)

placeholder.description: Title Description of the input desired

value.description: The initial value for a field

Input.Text.description: Input.Text collects text from the user,

id.description: Id for the value (will be used to identify collected input when Action.Submit is clicked)

isMultiline.description: Allow multiple lines of text input

maxLength.description: hint of maximum length characters to collect (may be ignored by some clients)

placeholder.description: Title Description of the input desired

value.description: The initial value for a field

Input.Time.description: Input.Time collects Time from the user,

id.description: Id for the value (will be used to identify collected input when Action.Submit is clicked)

max.description: hint of maximum value (may be ignored by some clients)

min.description: hint of minimum value (may be ignored by some clients)

placeholder.description: Title Description of the input desired

value.description: The initial value for a field expressed in ISO-8601 format

Input.Toggle.description: Input.Toggle collects a true/false response from the user

id.description: Id for the value (will be used to identify collected input when Action.Submit is clicked)

value.description: The current selected value. If the item is selected that "valueOn" will be used, otherwise "valueOff"

valueOff.description: The value when toggle is off

valueOn.description: The value when toggle is on

TextBlock.description: The TextBlock Item allows for the inclusion of text, with various font sizes, weight and color, in Adaptive Cards.

color.description: Controls the color of TextBlock Items.

isSubtle.description: Indicates whether the color of the text should be slightly toned down to appear less prominent

maxLines.description: When Wrap is true, you can specify the maximum number of lines to allow the textBlock to use.

weight.description: Controls the weight of TextBlock Items

wrap.description: "true" if the text is allowed to wrap

SeparatorStyle.description: Indicates whether there should be a visible separator (e.g. a line) between the element and the one before it. If this property is not specified, no separator is displayed. If it is, a separator line is displayed. A separator will only appear if there was a preceding element.

thickness.description: Specifies the thickness of the separation line.

color.description: Specifies the color of the separation line.

SpacingStyle.description: Controls the amount of spacing between this element and the previous element.
